semantic_identifier: 142: feat: Respect Simple Mode on Alerts/Templates/Models settings with progressive disclosure of advanced options

sections.text:
## Description

Implements post-onboarding Simple Mode progressive disclosure across the Alerts, Templates, and Models settings pages.

Key changes:
- Adds a workspace-mode gate to each settings page so Simple Mode renders only the recommended/core controls by default.
- Moves non-core/advanced knobs into a dedicated, collapsed-by-default “Advanced settings” section.
- Ensures consistency on navigation and hard refresh by sourcing the current workspace mode from persisted workspace settings during page load (no reliance on in-memory UI state).
- Preserves existing configuration when toggling modes: switching from Simple → Advanced reveals previously configured advanced fields without resetting values; switching back to Simple hides advanced fields but keeps their saved values intact.

Implementation notes (high-level):
- Introduces a shared helper/component for “Advanced settings” disclosure to keep behavior consistent across the three pages.
- Updates form rendering logic to conditionally include advanced fields while keeping them registered with the underlying model/state so values remain stable.
- Adds/updates tests to cover: Simple Mode default view, disclosure expand/collapse, mode changes, and refresh/navigation persistence.

User impact:
- Simple Mode users see a simplified configuration experience on Alerts/Templates/Models, with advanced options available only after explicitly expanding “Advanced settings.”

## How Has This Been Tested?
